Class Snake

  • java.lang.Object
    • Sprite
      • Snake
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Snake
extends Sprite
implements java.io.Serializable
    This represents the Snake object. It is a child of sprite class and is serializable. It stores an ArrayList of balls corresponding to its length.
    Author:
    SHUBHAM THAKRAL, TANMAY BANSAL
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      In the constructor, we take screenCoordinates and pass it to the super class constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Snake

        public Snake(int[] screenCoordinates)
        In the constructor, we take screenCoordinates and pass it to the super class constructor. Length of snake is initialized to 6 and 6 balls are added in its arrayList. coins and score are initialized to zero. destroyAllBlocks is set to fault.
        Parameters:
        screenCoordinates - is an array of upper and lower bounds of the screen in XY plane. It is taken so that objects can know the boundaries of screen.

    • Method Detail

      • setImage

        public void setImage(javafx.scene.image.Image i)
        This method overrides the setImage(Image) method of Sprite class so that image can be set for all the balls in snake
        Overrides:
        setImage in class Sprite
        Parameters:
        i - is the Image object that is the sprite's image to be set.

        Parameters:
        filename - is the name of image path

      • update

        public void update(double time)
        This method defines the abstract method update of Sprite class so that the positions of all balls are updated. To bring a smooth and wavy movement, it sets the positionX of a ball to the 4th previous state of positionX of the ball above it. This method also updates the time for shield, magnet and double score.
        Specified by:
        update in class Sprite
        Parameters:
        time - is duration for which we want to update

      • render

        public void render(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
        This method overrides the render method of Sprite class so that all the images of balls are displayed along with the length of the snake on top. Note that this length displayed doesn't include the head. So if snake has 3 balls, then its length displayed will be 2 as 1 is head. But the actual len variable will have the value 3.
        Overrides:
        render in class Sprite
        Parameters:
        gc - is the GraphicContext of Canvas where we draw the image

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Sprite s)
        This method override instersects of Sprite class and calls the intersect method on first ball as it is the one which will intersect.
        Overrides:
        intersects in class Sprite
        Parameters:
        s - is the sprite with which collision needs to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the sprites intersects, else returns false

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method overrides the toString method of Sprite class to display Snake's length also
        Overrides:
        toString in class Sprite

      • decreaseLength

        public void decreaseLength()
                    throws SnakeLengthZeroException
        This method decreases length of the snake by 1 by removing one ball from the ArrayList of balls.
        Throws:
        SnakeLengthZeroException - if snake has died

      • addBalls

        public void addBalls(int n)
        This adds n balls to the length of the snake.
        Parameters:
        n - is the number of balls to be added

      • activateShield

        public void activateShield()
        This method activates the shield by setting shieldTime to 5 seconds

      • isShieldActive

        public boolean isShieldActive()
        This method checks if the shield is still active by comparing its time to zero.
        Returns:
        true if the shield is active, else false

      • activateMagnet

        public void activateMagnet()
        This method activates the magnet by setting magnetTime to 5 seconds

        This method checks if the magnet is still active by comparing its time to zero.
        Returns:
        true if the magnet is active, else false

      • activateDoubleScore

        public void activateDoubleScore()
        This method activates the shield by setting doubleScoreTime to 5 seconds

      • incrementScore

        public void incrementScore(int num)
        This method increments the score. The score is incremented by num if doubleScorePowerUp is not active, else it is incremented by num*2
        Parameters:
        num - is the number by which score needs to increase

      • magnetBoundary

        public javafx.scene.shape.Circle magnetBoundary()
        This method is used to get the boundary for magnet attraction radius. This used isMagnetActive() method to check if magnet is even active.
        Returns:
        Circle object which represents the area in which coin can be attracted

      • magnetIntersects

        public boolean magnetIntersects(Coin coin)
        This method is used to check if the coin is within the attractable region of the magnet, if the magnet is active.
        Parameters:
        coin - is the Coin object which is being checked
        Returns:
        true if coin can be attracted, else false

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        This method returns the value of getter setter.
        Returns:
        length of the snake

        public void addCoin()
        This method adds one coin to the coin variable

        public int getCoins()
        This methods returns the number of coins

        coin variable's value

      • activateDestroyAllBlocks

        public void activateDestroyAllBlocks()
        This method activates the DestroyAllBlock variable by making it true, thus allowing the snake to destroy all blocks.

      • consumeDestroyAllBlocks

        public boolean consumeDestroyAllBlocks()
        This method consumes the DestroyAllBlock variable if it is active, i.e. makes it false.
        Returns:
        true if destroyAllBlocks was true i.e allBlocks need to be destroyed, else false

      • getShieldTime

        public int getShieldTime()
        It returns the time left for which shield will still be active
        Returns:
        shieldTime variable's value

        public int getScore()
        It returns the score made by the snake
        Returns:
        the value of score variable

      • isDoubleScoreActive

        public boolean isDoubleScoreActive()
        This method checks if the DoubleScorePowerUp is still active by comparing its time to zero.
